availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas S. Logwood (Fayette County, Kentucky, carriage smith)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, carriage smith. Virginia native. Married to Susan P. Logwood. Father of Thomas S. Logwood and Edmund C. Logwood. Blacksmith in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Carriage smith in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 2, p. 217B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, Ward 3, Lexington, p. 113
